intro: Epilobium halleri, commonly known as Haller's willowherb, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and typically grows in moist, often calcareous soils. The plant features slender, erect stems with opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are often hairy. Its showy, pink to purple flowers are arranged in terminal clusters and bloom in the summer months. Epilobium halleri is often found in wet meadows, stream banks, and other damp habitats.
